Package jpass.crypt

Class Aes256

java.lang.Object
jpass.crypt.Aes256
public final class Aes256
extends Object
Implementation of the "Advanced Encryption Standard" (AES) with a key size of 256 bit. The specification in "Federal Information Processing Standards Publication 197" defines the following key sizes:
  • 128 bit,
  • 192 bit,
  • 256 bit.
To make this implementation more compact, only the strongest version will be implemented.

The block size is 128 bit.

Version:
$Revision: 1.3 $
Author:
Timm Knape

  • Field Details

    • WORD_SIZE

      private static final int WORD_SIZE
      Number of bytes needed for 32 bit words.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • BLOCK_SIZE

      private static final int BLOCK_SIZE
      Number of bytes for a data block. The size is identical to the size of the internal state, that is needed in encryption or decryption.

      The state can be viewed as a square matrix, modeled as a list of column vectors.

      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • KEY_SIZE

      private static final int KEY_SIZE
      key size in bytes
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • ROUNDS

      private static final int ROUNDS
      number of rounds
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • EXPANDED_KEY_SIZE

      private static final int EXPANDED_KEY_SIZE
      Size of the expanded key. For each round a BLOCK_SIZE block will be needed. Before the first round another block will be needed.
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • _expandedKey

      private final byte[] _expandedKey
      expanded key

    • _tmp

      private final byte[] _tmp
      state needed between rounds in en- or decryption

    • _sBox

      private final byte[] _sBox
      Permutation of bytes. The s-box permutation was specified in the reference document.

    • _invSBox

      private final byte[] _invSBox
      Inverse of the s-box permutation.

  • Constructor Details

    • Aes256

      public Aes256​(byte[] key)
      Expands the key. The incoming key is KEY_SIZE bytes long. It will be expanded to a length of EXPANDED_KEY_SIZE bytes. The expanded key will be stored in _expandedKey.

      The encryption and decryption will use the expanded key.

      Parameters:
      key - key for the AES algorithm

  • Method Details

    • substituteWord

      private byte[] substituteWord​(byte[] value)
      Substitutes all bytes in a word. The word array will be changed.
      Parameters:
      value - array in which the first WORD_SIZE bytes will be substituted. This array will be modified.
      Returns:
      returns the modified value

    • rotate

      private byte[] rotate​(byte[] value)
      Rotate the byte's in a word. The byte's will be cycled left by one byte. The modification will be in place, so the original argument is changed after the method invocation.
      Parameters:
      value - Array in which the first WORD_SIZE byte's will be changed due to the rotation. The contents of this array is changed by this invocation.

    • addRoundKey

      private void addRoundKey​(int index)
      Combines the state with the expanded key. The bytes will be combined by XOR.
      Parameters:
      index - start of the part of the expanded key, that will be used for the combination

    • times2

      private int times2​(int b)
      The polynomial represented by b will be multiplied by its free variable. This multiplication takes place in a finite field. The resulting polynomial can still be represented in one byte.

      The bits 0 to 7 are the coefficients of the powers x to x**8.

      Parameters:
      b - origin polynomial
      Returns:
      multiplied polynomial

    • mul

      private byte mul​(int a, byte b)
      Two polynomial will be multiplied with each other. The representation of the polynomial is described in times2(int).

      The multiplication will be performed by successive invocations of times2(int).

      Parameters:
      a - first polynomial
      b - second polynomial
      Returns:
      result of the multiplication

    • substituteState

      private void substituteState()
      Changes all bytes in the state by the s-box.

    • shiftRows

      private void shiftRows()
      Rotates the last three rows of the state.

    • mixColumn

      private void mixColumn​(int index)
      Mixes one column of the state.
      Parameters:
      index - position of the first element of the column

    • mixColumns

      private void mixColumns()
      Mixes all columns of the state.

    • encrypt

      public void encrypt​(byte[] inBlock, int inIndex, byte[] outBlock, int outIndex)
      Encrypts one block. The input block lies in inBlock starting at the position inIndex. The inBlock won't be modified by this method. The encrypted block will be stored in outBlock starting at position outIndex.
      Parameters:
      inBlock - array containing the input block
      inIndex - starting of the input block in inBlock
      outBlock - array to store the encrypted block
      outIndex - starting of the encrypted block in outBlock

    • invShiftRows

      private void invShiftRows()
      Rotates the last three rows of the state. This method inverses shiftRows().

    • invSubstituteState

      private void invSubstituteState()
      Changes all bytes of the state. This method is the inverse of shiftRows().

    • invMixColumn

      private void invMixColumn​(int index)
      Mixes a column of the state. This method inverses mixColumn(int).
      Parameters:
      index - position of the first entry of the row

    • invMixColumns

      private void invMixColumns()
      Mixes all columns of the state. This method inverses mixColumns().

    • decrypt

      public void decrypt​(byte[] inBlock, int inIndex, byte[] outBlock, int outIndex)
      Decrypts a block. The encrypted block starts at inIndex in inBlock. inBlock won't be modified by this method. The decrypted block will be stored at outIndex in outBlock.
      Parameters:
      inBlock - array containing the encrypted block
      inIndex - starting point of the encrypted block
      outBlock - array to store the decrypted block
      outIndex - position of the decrypted block
